intro: Lepidium virginicum var. ramosum, commonly known as prairie cress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils. It produces small white or yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided. The seeds are small and contained in pods, which are characteristic of the mustard family.
